page.title: 12Ormskirk Golf Club
page.content: Ormskirk Golf Club was established in 1890. Originally part of the Lathom estate it was sold in 1920.Standing on Cranes Lanes,the clubhouse caters for a membership of 300 men and 150 'lady subscribers'as they are called.The club is run by 4 trustees,who hold that position until their death. Although the 1980's has seen increased leisure this does not affect the Golf Club since their numbers are strictly regulated and there is a long waiting list to join. Ormskirk has or have had members who have achieved notoriety in the sport. Dr.David Marsh Captained his country as an amateur player,and David Eccleston, still a member,was runner up to Nick Faldo in a tournament. One member,MrG.H.Riding,of 45 Bridge Street,Ormskirk got a Hole-in-One using a 7iron at the 135yds 14th hole in July
